14#ifndef DNS_ACL_H
15#define DNS_ACL_H 1
16
17/*****
18 ***** Module Info
19 *****/
20
21/*! \file dns/acl.h
22 * \brief
23 * Address match list handling.
24 */
25
26/***
27 *** Imports
28 ***/
29
30#include <stdbool.h>
31
32#include <isc/lang.h>
33#include <isc/magic.h>
34#include <isc/netaddr.h>
35#include <isc/refcount.h>
36
37#ifdef HAVE_GEOIP
38#include <dns/geoip.h>
39#endif
40#include <dns/name.h>
41#include <dns/types.h>
42#include <dns/iptable.h>
43
44#ifdef HAVE_GEOIP
45#include <GeoIP.h>
46#endif
47
48/***
49 *** Types
50 ***/
51
52typedef enum {
53 dns_aclelementtype_ipprefix,
54 dns_aclelementtype_keyname,
55 dns_aclelementtype_nestedacl,
56 dns_aclelementtype_localhost,
57 dns_aclelementtype_localnets,
58#ifdef HAVE_GEOIP
59 dns_aclelementtype_geoip,
60#endif /* HAVE_GEOIP */
61 dns_aclelementtype_any
62} dns_aclelementtype_t;
63
64typedef struct dns_aclipprefix dns_aclipprefix_t;
65
66struct dns_aclipprefix {
67 isc_netaddr_t address; /* IP4/IP6 */
68 unsigned int prefixlen;
69};
70
71struct dns_aclelement {
72 dns_aclelementtype_t type;
73 bool negative;
74 dns_name_t keyname;
75#ifdef HAVE_GEOIP
76 dns_geoip_elem_t geoip_elem;
77#endif /* HAVE_GEOIP */
78 dns_acl_t *nestedacl;
79 int node_num;
80};
81
82struct dns_acl {
83 unsigned int magic;
84 isc_mem_t *mctx;
85 isc_refcount_t refcount;
86 dns_iptable_t *iptable;
87#define node_count iptable->radix->num_added_node
88 dns_aclelement_t *elements;
89 bool has_negatives;
90 unsigned int alloc; /*%< Elements allocated */
91 unsigned int length; /*%< Elements initialized */
92 char *name; /*%< Temporary use only */
93 ISC_LINK(dns_acl_t) nextincache; /*%< Ditto */
94};
95
96struct dns_aclenv {
97 dns_acl_t *localhost;
98 dns_acl_t *localnets;
99 bool match_mapped;
100#ifdef HAVE_GEOIP
101 dns_geoip_databases_t *geoip;
102#endif
103};
104
105#define DNS_ACL_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('D','a','c','l')
106#define DNS_ACL_VALID(a) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(a, DNS_ACL_MAGIC)
107
108/***
109 *** Functions
110 ***/
111
112ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
113
114isc_result_t
115dns_acl_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, int n, dns_acl_t **target);
116/*%<
117 * Create a new ACL, including an IP table and an array with room
118 * for 'n' ACL elements. The elements are uninitialized and the
119 * length is 0.
120 */
121
122isc_result_t
123dns_acl_any(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_acl_t **target);
124/*%<
125 * Create a new ACL that matches everything.
126 */
127
128isc_result_t
129dns_acl_none(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_acl_t **target);
130/*%<
131 * Create a new ACL that matches nothing.
132 */
133
134bool
135dns_acl_isany(dns_acl_t *acl);
136/*%<
137 * Test whether ACL is set to "{ any; }"
138 */
139
140bool
141dns_acl_isnone(dns_acl_t *acl);
142/*%<
143 * Test whether ACL is set to "{ none; }"
144 */
145
146isc_result_t
147dns_acl_merge(dns_acl_t *dest, dns_acl_t *source, bool pos);
148/*%<
149 * Merge the contents of one ACL into another. Call dns_iptable_merge()
150 * for the IP tables, then concatenate the element arrays.
151 *
152 * If pos is set to false, then the nested ACL is to be negated. This
153 * means reverse the sense of each *positive* element or IP table node,
154 * but leave negatives alone, so as to prevent a double-negative causing
155 * an unexpected positive match in the parent ACL.
156 */
157
158void
159dns_acl_attach(dns_acl_t *source, dns_acl_t **target);
160/*%<
161 * Attach to acl 'source'.
162 *
163 * Requires:
164 *\li 'source' to be a valid acl.
165 *\li 'target' to be non NULL and '*target' to be NULL.
166 */
167
168void
169dns_acl_detach(dns_acl_t **aclp);
170/*%<
171 * Detach the acl. On final detach the acl must not be linked on any
172 * list.
173 *
174 * Requires:
175 *\li '*aclp' to be a valid acl.
176 *
177 * Insists:
178 *\li '*aclp' is not linked on final detach.
179 */
180
181bool
182dns_acl_isinsecure(const dns_acl_t *a);
183/*%<
184 * Return #true iff the acl 'a' is considered insecure, that is,
185 * if it contains IP addresses other than those of the local host.
186 * This is intended for applications such as printing warning
187 * messages for suspect ACLs; it is not intended for making access
188 * control decisions. We make no guarantee that an ACL for which
189 * this function returns #false is safe.
190 */
191
192bool
193dns_acl_allowed(isc_netaddr_t *addr, dns_name_t *signer,
194 dns_acl_t *acl, dns_aclenv_t *aclenv);
195/*%<
196 * Return #true iff the 'addr', 'signer', or ECS values are
197 * permitted by 'acl' in environment 'aclenv'.
198 */
199
200isc_result_t
201dns_aclenv_init(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_aclenv_t *env);
202/*%<
203 * Initialize ACL environment, setting up localhost and localnets ACLs
204 */
205
206void
207dns_aclenv_copy(dns_aclenv_t *t, dns_aclenv_t *s);
208
209void
210dns_aclenv_destroy(dns_aclenv_t *env);
211
212isc_result_t
213dns_acl_match(const isc_netaddr_t *reqaddr,
214 const dns_name_t *reqsigner,
215 const dns_acl_t *acl,
216 const dns_aclenv_t *env,
217 int *match,
218 const dns_aclelement_t **matchelt);
219/*%<
220 * General, low-level ACL matching. This is expected to
221 * be useful even for weird stuff like the topology and sortlist statements.
222 *
223 * Match the address 'reqaddr', and optionally the key name 'reqsigner',
224 * against 'acl'. 'reqsigner' may be NULL.
225 *
226 * If there is a match, '*match' will be set to an integer whose absolute
227 * value corresponds to the order in which the matching value was inserted
228 * into the ACL. For a positive match, this value will be positive; for a
229 * negative match, it will be negative.
230 *
231 * If there is no match, *match will be set to zero.
232 *
233 * If there is a match in the element list (either positive or negative)
234 * and 'matchelt' is non-NULL, *matchelt will be pointed to the matching
235 * element.
236 *
237 * 'env' points to the current ACL environment, including the
238 * current values of localhost and localnets and (if applicable)
239 * the GeoIP context.
240 *
241 * Returns:
242 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS Always succeeds.
243 */
244
245bool
246dns_aclelement_match(const isc_netaddr_t *reqaddr,
247 const dns_name_t *reqsigner,
248 const dns_aclelement_t *e,
249 const dns_aclenv_t *env,
250 const dns_aclelement_t **matchelt);
251/*%<
252 * Like dns_acl_match, but matches against the single ACL element 'e'
253 * rather than a complete ACL, and returns true iff it matched.
254 *
255 * To determine whether the match was positive or negative, the
256 * caller should examine e->negative. Since the element 'e' may be
257 * a reference to a named ACL or a nested ACL, a matching element
258 * returned through 'matchelt' is not necessarily 'e' itself.
259 */
260
261ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
262
263#endif /* DNS_ACL_H */
264
